headline: Netskope IPO In Demand as AI Era Heightens Cyber Threats
summary: Early Tuesday, Netskope raised its marketing range to seek as much as $908.2 million, not a surprise given the similar progression of many software IPOs in the recent past, and a move that points to a robust outcome when the offering prices as scheduled late Wednesday.  The deal is about 20 times oversubscribed, Bloomberg News reported earlier Tuesday.  With analysts predicting that spending on cybersecurity will outpace that of enterprise software as a whole, investors are set to seize on Netskope’s outsize growth.

headline: Palo Alto Networks Stock is Up, But Analysts Have Raised Their Targets
summary: Palo Alto Networks' stock has risen over 14% since the Aug. 14 release of its fiscal Q4 earnings. But it could still have further to go, as analysts have raised their targets. Moreover, shorting out-of-the-money puts works here.

headline: Cybersecurity Stocks: Netskope Hikes IPO Price, Aims To Raise $900 Million
summary: In the second IPO for cybersecurity stocks in 2025, Netskope raised its proposed price range to 17 to 19. Netskope stock will trade on the Nasdaq.

headline: Okta CEO on the quarterly reports debate: Less obsession with numbers, more conversation with investors
summary: After a Q2 revenue beat, Okta CEO Todd McKinnon says companies focus too much on short-term numbers, but investors still want the details.

raw.headline: Okta CEO on the quarterly reports debate: Less obsession with numbers, more conversation with investors
raw.summary: After a Q2 revenue beat, Okta CEO Todd McKinnon says companies focus too much on short-term numbers, but investors still want the details.

headline: Okta is providing extra security to AI agents, your data: CEO
summary: Shares of identity security company Okta (OKTA) are up by over 14% in 2025 as cybersecurity becomes an invaluable asset for AI products. Okta faces tough competition from Palo Alto Networks (PANW) and CrowdStrike (CRWD). Okta CEO Todd McKinnon sits down with Opening Bid anchor Brian Sozzi to discuss the importance of integrating cybersecurity barriers and identity networks into AI, commenting on what the future of cyber attacks could look like. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: PANW's Platform Strategy Builds Momentum: Can it Hit $15B ARR Target?
summary: Palo Alto Networks gains momentum with platformization, landing mega-deals as NGS ARR climbs toward its $15B target.

headline: Israeli cybersecurity startup Vega raises $65 million, valued at $400 million
summary: JERUSALEM (Reuters) -Israeli cybersecurity startup Vega said on Tuesday it had raised $65 million in early-stage financing rounds that valued it at $400 million.  The funding, which included so-called seed and Series A funding, was led by venture capital fund Accel, with participation from venture capital funds Cyberstarts, Redpoint and CRV.  Israel is a global leader in cyber security.

headline: Mark Anderson joins Verkada's Board of Directors
summary: Verkada, a leader in AI-powered physical security technology, today announced that Mark Anderson joined its Board of Directors.

raw.headline: Mark Anderson joins Verkada's Board of Directors

headline: Cybersecurity firm Netskope lifts IPO price range, eyes $7.3 billion valuation
summary: Netskope's offering marks the second notable cybersecurity IPO of 2025 in New York after Thoma Bravo-backed SailPoint listed its shares in February and comes at a time when stricter data privacy regulations and the rise of AI-driven threats act as tailwinds for the secure access service edge (SASE) market.  The new targeted valuation puts Netskope closer to the $7.5 billion it commanded in a 2021 funding round led by investment firm ICONIQ.
